headline: Banana Pancakes
description: Quick and easy homemade banana pancakes made from scratch. A fun twist on ordinary pancakes.

video.description: Whip up these easy pancakes, and make everyone's breakfast a fun one.
video.name: Banana Pancakes I

name: Banana Pancakes

recipeInstructions.text: Combine flour, white sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. Mix together egg, milk, vegetable oil, and bananas in a second bowl.
Stir flour mixture into banana mixture; batter will be slightly lumpy.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake.
Cook until pancakes are golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes per side. Serve hot.

review.reviewBody: I like recipes like this because they‚Äôre to the point and very simple to follow Now I know that I have to get bananas that are ripe for more taste but it was great
I loved it!! So easy and yummy! I added chocolate chunks and that made it 10x better, highly recommend.

I've got an 18 month old who loves bananas and I've been questing for the bananiest banana pancake recipe. This is not it, but this forms the foundation of the recipe I now use. Instead of two ripe bananas, I've increased that to around 3 or 4 depending on size. I decrease the milk a bit to accommodate the extra banana liquid. I'll also throw in 1/8 tsp of vanilla for oomph into the liquid. And the coup de gras is I chop up a banana into really small pieces and fold that into the batter after the initial mixing. And that is how I now make my child the bananiest banana pancakes. The banana content is so hi that perhaps they are more like banana fritters at that point, but there's no questioning, no matter how unsophisticated a palate you might have, that what you are eating has banana in it. I hope these adjustments help other parents who find themselves in my situation.

For those vegetarians out there: You can totally sub this as a vegetarian recipe, just sub the milk for almond milk. Banana naturally works as a binder, so you don't need the egg! This is why people are finding theirs too mushy. Thank me later.
I soured my milk with apple cider vinegar, added blueberries and some chopped nuts. Nutritional content is way better than other banana pancakes.
I doubled this recipe but reduced milk by 3/4 cup, so instead of 2 cups of milk, I added 1 1/4 cup of milk. After reading reviews about it being overly mushy, I reduced the milk. Came out perfect.
The flavor of the pancakes was delicious, however I did not care for the texture. Maybe my bananas were too big, but my pancakes were a little too mushy for me.
Served it with banana pieces, honey and cinnamon. Perfect!
Love this recipe! Always make extra batter to save for grab-n-go peanut butter banana pancake sandwiches for anytime on the run!!
Super easy and delicious... I definitely prefer with the touch of cinnamon as well.
I am going to make these banana pancakes this week. The grandchildren will love them with syrup or peanut butter. Thanks for the info about how to freeze uneaten pancakes.
These were so yummy and moist! Added cinnamon, cayenne, and vanilla to make it my own.
I made this and it came out so good I love it

I followed the recipe exactly. If I'd closed my eyes, I'd have thought I was at a restaurant. They were that good. I used really ripe bananas and high grade Maple syrup. The side was an thick sliced Applewood bacon from our international farmers market. It was "slap 'yo Mama" good!

Loved this! The video was extremely helpful - Normally when cooking with bananas I use over ripe banana but for this recipe be sure to use yellow ripe bananas. Using over ripe bananas will make the pancakes too mushy.
Terrible recipe turned into scrambled banana pancakes ü•∫

I made this for the first time and it was aaaaaaaamazing!! I tweaked the recipe used about 3/4cup of milk, butter instead of oil, used 1/8 teaspoon salt and the pancakes came out fluffy and delicious !! üëçüèΩüëçüèΩ

I have made these before and the family can't get enough of them. When the grandkids are at my house for breakfast, I add a cup of mini chocolate chips to the batter. They wolf them down and beg for more.
No need for 2 teaspoons of baking power for me though . Just a quality flour and even less than 1 teaspoon did the trick. Came out fluffy. Used brown sugar instead.
I love this recipe! However, I‚Äôm not a big fan of canola oil so I substitute it for butter.
Our Go-To Saturday banana pancake recipe! The riper the bananas the better!

This recipe did not turn out for me. Terrible texture & underwhelming flavor. I tried cooking the first one for much longer than the recipe said because it was so wet in the middle. I ended up putting it on a plate & it was wet & hollow in the middle like a pita. I pulled apart each side & threw those back in the pan. Taste was not good. Sad waste of 2 ripe bananas : (
Batter was a bit thick, but I did use a combination of gluten free flour and almond flour, so I would add more liquid or another egg next time
Flat, mushy, overwhelming baking powder taste. I made an account solely to share my experience. Just, blegh
very yum 10/10 would rcommend
there was too much banana

absolutely loved the recipe. I used it to salvage four over-ripe bananas and it turned out amazing. i didn't mash the bananas as much as i could, but left some chunks instead so while eating the pancakes you get random bits of extra sweetness and the batter in itself is sweet as well. they were so good my friends and i didn't even bother with the toppings.
Added a handful of chocolate chips once the batter was mixed and about 2 tsps of cinnamon.
This is the best recipe of pancakes I ever made. They‚Äôre soft and really tasty. Thank you for sharing! My family love it too.
Excellent! I don't think the sugar is needed. Will def make this again.

It's not a bad recipe but there is way too much liquid for an American pancake recipe I omitted some of the milk and added a bit more flour. If I were making it again I'd use 150ml of milk to each cup of flour. You can always add more liquid to get the right consistency but you can't take it out.

Made this recipe true to the T (however, I doubled it because I had 4 very ripe bananas to use) and it was PERFECT! We had rave reviews and enough left over to freeze. (Used a quart freezer bag and cut squares of parchment paper a bit smaller than the bags and layered the remaining pancakes with a square in between each one and froze 4 per bag.) They thaw quickly and microwave great. Highly recommend!!
I added chocolate chips and they were delicious! Make sure to use overripe bananas for a better texture

Great way to use up overripe bananas, which it seems we always have. I had 4 bananas so I doubled this. Used 1 cup white flour and 1 cup whole wheat. Used a 3.9 oz container of Mott's unsweetened applesauce instead of the oil. Used 2% milk. Beat the liquid ingredients till smooth; I don't like chunks of banana. Then added the dry ingredients and beat just until moist. Cooked these on my griddle, scooping out 1/4 cup for each pancake. These were great! Next time I might add some vanilla and cinnamon. I put 12 in the freezer; hope they are good! With my changes these are 153 calories, 29g carbs, 5g protein, 3g fiber and only 2g fat for 2 pancakes. A very healthy breakfast!
I simply love this recipe.It tastes good.Instead of a pan I used a non stick griddle which was quite convenient.

Perfect use for those overripe bananas on your counter or in the freezer. By the time a freezer bag of frozen chunks of 2 1/2 bananas thawed in a bowl some of the liquid had flowed out and it was very easy to combine and mesh. Our family loved them; some topped with slices of ripe bananas, others with sliced strawberries. So sweet syrup is not needed.
I used soy milk and added 1tsp of vanilla cinnamon powder. It was delicious

I love this fast, easy, delicious recipe. I didn‚Äôt have milk so I used a splash of 1/2 and 1/2 with water for the rest. I 'lost' this simple recipe for a while and tried quite a few that were not good at all until I finally found this winner again!
Amazing I won the pancake contest

I love this recipe. It's the first one I could easily incorporate my budding toddler into and have a great time. The pancakes are delicious and so easy, I felt I made so many substitutions based on what I actually had and needed to use: I used one frozen banana to mash and one ripe that I had left, for the milk, I had half a cup of heavy cream that needed to go so I cut it with half a cup of hot water for proper substitution and to mash the banana into, I only have Costco's "creamy canola oil" which I used in direct replacement for the veggie oil, also I added 1-2 tsp vanilla extract to my wet mix. I followed all the rest. They were bomb delicious! My toddler cannot get enough and she's going through a picky phase of independence. I saved this recipe and had to come back to rate it, I wish I could give it more. On top of that, it's one of the only hearty breakfast items I've made while in my last trimester that hasn't given me indigestion! Absolutely outstanding, highly recommend.

Subbed butter for oil, added a little vanilla, cinnamon and pecans. Nice and fluffy. Next time will add a little more sugar. If you‚Äôre gonna add syrup it‚Äôs probably perfect but I just wanted to butter mine and have faux banana nut bread. Might add nutmeg too next time.
Very good way to use overly ripened bananas
Loved it used all ingrediants

This came out soo perfect! I don‚Äôt know why people complain about it being mushy! It came out fluffy and delicious! I followed to recipe and didn‚Äôt substitute anything. Served with plain yogurt , my toddler loved it!

I made this recipe this morning for my family. I do feel that the batter was a bit thin. I will know for next time to adjust for that. The flavor is very good, with just the right amount of banana. My son is happy, therefore I am happy.
Amazing pancakes! Really easy to make. If you want fluffier pancakes, definitely don't do as much milk as the recipe calls for. These are absolutely amazing!

3/5 stars because the batter was way too thin if you follow the recipe. 

IF you want a 5/5 star recipe, add the following: 
- Additional 1/2 cup of flour (total of 1.5 cup of flour)
- 1 to 2 tsp of vanilla (tried using a homemade rum vanilla one time and I would highly recommend it. Very Good!)
- 1 tsp of cinnamon

Overall, the recipe is good, but we don't like thin pancakes (reason for giving 3/5 stars). Great banana flavor, especially when the bananas get lots of black spots on the outside. If you like thin pancakes this is a recipe you shouldn't change much and would likely get all 5 stars :)
10/10 absolutely perfect!
amazing

Kids favorite pancakes

Yum

Perfect recipe
Delicious. Very tasty and filling.
This recipe is terrific. Eat this too much sometimes. We use maple syrup and use butter and fresh water to reduce it s bit so it‚Äôs not too sweet!
HANDS DOWN BEST RECIPE EVER!! although I did add vanilla essence and didn't use as much milk as I like a thicker batter but truly the best pancake recipe. I added choc chip cookies .
Very good, I used applesauce instead of oil, so good!
Maybe a clarification is missing in the recipe but these were the most doughy pancakes I‚Äôve ever made and had 0 flavour.

AH-MAZING! My 10 year old twins were the quietest they ever been eating these delicious pancakes. I added my twist to the recipe with 1 tbsp of sugar free calorie free caramel pecan flavouring in the batter! Tasted like dessert for breakfast!!
I loved it! It was super delicious!
I made these for my mom's 43rd bday and it's was very easy to make and very delicious. Fully recommend.

These were really good! I made them like a crepe - flat and big, and they were a bit too filling. I was full after one pancake, so maybe the bananas make the pancakes heavier. So yummy though! Also, I decided to bake them for 380 F, for 10 minutes and they smelled so good! No matter, they were pretty good and even picky-eaters in my family loved them. Would make again! Thank you! Also the banana pancake smell is amazing!
Super good and fluffy!
Added half cup flour and used brown sugar and vanilla + banana extract (i always add banana extract bc i like fhe flavor it definitely wasn‚Äôt necessary) and it was great, good base recipe
These were excellent! Everyone devoured them in a flash. I let the batter rest for about half an hour before I started cooking - I think that helped to make them more consistent.

I've made these twice. The first time, they were 10 star pancakes, looked like they belonged in a food magazine photo layout and were the best tasting pancakes I ever had: fluffy on the inside, with little crispy edges on the outside. I made them again today and it was like all the bad reviews came true: kind of wet and spongy on the inside, and fairly tasteless. The first time was with smaller bananas, today they were much larger and while overripe, maybe a little less than the first time around. I'll give it one more try one of these days, because I know these have great potential!

The original recipe is delicious by itself but I'm currently pregnant so I tweeked the recipe for a more health conscious version. I substituted the white flour for whole wheat adding an additional 2 tsp of milk to account for the change. I also substituted the white sugar for brown and added a dash of cinnamon. They turned about amazing. Another healthy alternative to syrup is low fat vanilla yogurt

Great recipe. I made it vegan by substituting the egg with bob's red mill egg replacer. I didn't have plant based milk, so I added water. It was the perfect consistency. My go to banana pancake recipe.

This recipe is definitely a NONO 
the taste the thickness And stickiness and how it's aughfully hard to switch to the other side ... DEFINETLY not Worth it !
Delicious! It‚Äôs kind of my thing now, it never fails!

Very fluffy and tasty pancakes. I did add some cinnamon and vanilla to the egg mixture. I used olive oil as that‚Äôs all I had. Came out perfect. Make sure to cook thoroughly as suggested by other commenters
This is a decent recipe. I add some vanilla and cinnamon. However, do not substitute baking powder with baking soda! They are not interchangeable.
I doubled the recipe, added an additional tablespoon of oil, and threw in mini chocolate chips, right before I flipped it, for my kids. They ate it up! Such a great simple recipe! Thank you!

This recipe did not work out for me. I 
 ended up having to add in 3/4 more flour and 1 tbsp more baking soda. I wondered if my bkg soda was expired but it wasn't! Hmm.. came out more like crepes on the first panful.
Very yummy.
These were very, very good. I had really overripe bananas and adding a little of vanilla just took the ordinary pancake to another level.

I made it with my older sibling a couple times. It turned out great each time, except for one time when we swapped the flour for rice flour (our fault). Great for when we have too many bananas that are going ripe. This yields quite a bit, perfect for 3-4 very hungry people. We once added Milo powder into it (didn‚Äôt turn out that well). Stick to the original recipe. Overall a great, easy recipe.
So easy and so delicious! My kids loved them and we‚Äôll definitely be making them again!

As someone else mentioned the pancakes were too moist. I used powered milk instead of milk and added some cinnamon which shouldn't affect the texture. I added frozen blueberries to some and froze them.
I'm hoping after freezing and reheating in the air fryer the texture will improve. 
I'll skip this recipe in the future.
Easy and delicious!

There were great! Made for a 2 year old, added an extra egg for protein and substitute macadamia oil. following the recipe I think they would be great and the way we made him we're great thank you! *We didn't have ripe bananas, so I just missed them in the kitchen aid. Worked perfect!
Great! Easy make! My 2-year-old son likes
Absolutely awesome, my toddler loves them
Delicious! I added a tablespoon of vanilla and it was a hit!
Pretty good! Tasted fresh and banana-y which is perfect. They weren‚Äôt quite as sweet as I would have liked, so maybe some other sweetening. I also served banana and blueberries on the side. Yum!

Great recipe. I swapped out the milk for almond milk and the all purpose flour for gluten free all purpose flour. I used just one banana and added vanilla abstract, cinnamon, and nutmeg. I also used less sugar than the recipe called for. Overall, great pancakes!
Tip: it's best if you also put vanilla on it while making but a nice recipe

My husband and I loved them. I was out of vegetable oil and used melted butter instead. Topped with sliced banana whipped cream and a sprinkle of cinnamon. Would have given 5 stars if they were fluffier.

Way too much baking soda. Gives the pancakes a horrible taste. I would recommend adding cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla. Also, using three bananas will add to the banana flavour. With only two bananas there is hardly a banana taste.

Very delicious! Very sweet. Very light and airy. Great way to use very ripe bananas when you don‚Äôt feel like baking.I added vanilla and cinnamon as others suggested. I tend to use brown sugar with my pancake recipes.
These were fantastic! The perfect taste and texture for us.

Thank you so much for this simple recipe! My family enjoyed them. I substituted melted butter for the vegetable oil and used half whole wheat flour. I also followed others and added vanilla. Turned out fluffy and delic!!
It's so yummy! I made with less sugar and gave to my babies!
If you‚Äôd like a better recipe, go to your local grocer‚Äôs and pick up a box of Aunt Jemima‚Äôs just add water Pancakes. If you want bananas so bad, put them on top.
Made 12 perfect pancakes. I added 1/2 c chopped walnuts.
My fav banana pancake recipe! Really delicious and very quick to make!

Awesome pancakes!

Here were my changes: 
1. I used 1 cup ‚Äúbutter-soy milk‚Äù (1 Tbsp lemon juice added scant cup of soy milk, let it sit for 5 min)
2. Added 1/4 tsp cinnamon
3. Added a tsp of vanilla extract

So banana-y, and yes, they are mushy - on the inside, crisp and delicate on the outside. Delicious, fluffy, truly yummy.

Highly recommend.

That sad moment when you waste your two last bananas on the worst batter recipe ever. 

I can tell this is bad before even making the first pancake. SO WATERY and runny. I should have went with the red flag in my head when it called for 2 bananas instea of 1. 

Steer clear, no idea why this has so many star ratings.
Only change I substituted applesauce for the vegetable oil. (or do 1 tablespoon oil and 1 tablespoon applesauce) Really good.
Delicious! I used wheat flour and almond milk and they were great!
We eat many pancakes so I try to have a variety. I added a bit of vanilla and about 1/4 cup blueberries and some chopped walnuts. We all loved them.

These were so yummy! I really was expecting something ‚Äúhealthy‚Äù tasting. I don‚Äôt actually like traditional pancakes but make them for my kids. I was looking for a healthier version since I have a ton of bananas. I subbed the oil for 2 tablespoons of unsweetened applesauce but otherwise everything else was the same. The bananas I used were on the smaller side. Texture was very soft, like an enjoyable cloud. I will definitely make these again and Next time lll be making enough for me to have a real serving!
